column4: hey guys I have ubuntu 10.04 and would like to upgrade to 12.04, how ??
do-release-upgrade
but i guess before that I have to update my current 10.04 , correct ?
yeah.. make sure you're up to date, then use "do-release-upgrade" - you may want to wait as the servers are still being overloaded
but the main concern is, I am using screen terminal emulator, and will it work with unity ??
are you using the server version or the desktop version..?
desktop version
it will update you to unity... however, you're probably better doing a fresh install... upgrades are still a rough ride
I am a programmer and I normally prefer, screen, yeahconsole and vim , vim will surely work but I am not sure of the other two
they'll all work fine in 12.04
if anything is going to go wrong, it'll be your GUI
a fresh install will not be possible for me as I have lot of data now
then my advice would be to not upgrade until you've taken a backup
so, if we consider the worst condition, how can I gain back my GUI ??
with a reinstall... however it is possible that it might all die so I would backup just in case.... nmittal, sorry... can you post the contents of "sudo fdisk -l" into pastebin?
but I have data which is more than 600GB and it is not possible for me to find a spare hard disk
then I repeat, don't attempt an upgrade
so, how do I get ubuntu 12.04 ??
there should be a way
the way is to backup... always have a backup, it's foolish not to
nothing in the world recommends you upgrade without a backup
